articles.title: Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's demise commemorated
Economic and commercial councilors' corps visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace
articles.content:
Economic and commercial councilors' corps visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace 
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors' corps here visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on July 11 to pay its respects to President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the 8th anniversary of his demise.
 The guests paid homage to Kim Il Sung who lies in state for perpetuity.    
 They looked round with keen interest the orders, medals, the certificates of honorary titles awarded to him and the mourning hall and a train he used during his on-site guidance and foreign visits and a car used by him in the last period of his life. They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Jakarta, July 11 (KCNA correspondent) - General Secretary  Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Indonesian President Megawati Soekarnoputri.
 The gift was conveyed by the Indonesian President to Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Indonesia, on July 11.

Kanggye Wine Factory
articles.content:
Kanggye Wine Factory
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Kanggye Mine Factory is situated on the bank of the Puk River in Kanggye. It was commissioned in Juche 45 (1956).
 The factory equipped with up-to-date facilities produces Kanggye wine, Inphungsul, Kanggye wild grape wine. Its products, specialties of Jagang Province, are popular on domestic and foreign markets for their high quality and peculiar flavour.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam feted
Anniversary of victory of Mongolian People's Revolution celebrated
articles.content:
Anniversary of victory of Mongolian People's Revolution celebrated
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK Janchivdorjyn Lombo gave a reception on Thursday at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on the occasion of the 81st anniversary of the victory of the Mongolian People's Revolution.
 Present on invitation were Mun Il Bong, Minister of Finance and chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Association, Kim Yong Il, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jong Gi, vice-Minister of Foreign Trade, and other officials concerned.
 Speeches were made at the reception.
